intro: Ornithogalum mundianum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Ornithogalum mundianum is also valued for its ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
